summary: Creating a novel requires immense effort, challenging the misconception that writing is an easy task due to its non-traditional nature.
Extensive research is crucial in understanding characters and settings, forming the backbone of a well-developed narrative.
Careful planning is essential to ensure scenes are interconnected, contributing to a coherent and engaging story.
Writing involves prolonged dedication, including numerous revisions and proofreading to achieve a polished final product.
Beyond writing, pitching to publishers demands additional skills, highlighting the multifaceted challenges writers face.
The significant effort and creativity involved in writing a novel underscore the need to appreciate and value the work of writers.
